intro: Dischidia punctatoides, commonly known as the spotted stem vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a climbing or trailing vine that belongs to the family Apocynaceae. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Dischidia punctatoides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
